comments:
CDT HEAD:
Indexer now runs with just a few exceptions. See the attached log file.

Created an attachment (id=62965)
Log file with indexer exeptions

Created an attachment (id=63051)
proposed patch

Fixes the 6 exceptions:

1. CPPVisitor.getQualifiedNameCharArray(IBinding) was never altered to use the IName interface instead of the IASTName interface, as was done for CPPVisitor.getQualifiedName(IBinding).

2. Improper use of the ICPPInternalTemplate interface (not implemented by PDOM templates) instead of the ICPPInternalTemplateInstantiator interface.

3. Same as 1.

4. CPPFunctionSpecialization.addDefinition(IASTName) and addDeclaration(IASTName) were adding the passed IASTNames directly rather than adding the parents (ICPPASTFunctionDeclarations) of these names, as is done in CPPFunction.

5. Same as 4.

6. Ensures that problem bindings are no longer ever passed into PDOMCPPLinkage.addBinding(IBinding).
Looks fine. Patch applied. Thanks, Bryan!

Here are the exceptions I'm getting now with HEAD:

(From update of attachment 63051)
Obsoleting the patch since it's already been applied.

Created an attachment (id=63408)
more fixes

This patch resolves 2 of the 4 exceptions.

Exception #1: Implemented PDOMCPPClassSpecialization.getImplicitMethods() to get rid of the PDOMNotImplementedError.

Exception #4: The resultant arrays of PDOMCPPClassInstance.getBases() or PDOMCPPClassSpecialization.getBases() can no longer contain null entries.

Exceptions #2 and #3 are the same but I have yet to be able to reproduce the problem as the stack traces do not provide enough information.  Any additional information, or a small sample project exhibiting the exception, would be appreciated.

(From update of attachment 63408)
Patch applied, thanks Bryan. Leaving bug open for the remainder.
Marking this as fixed. The remaining exceptions #2 and #3 are also reported in bug 189300.
